Storing Deltas

Deltas contain only the changes that define each revision, resulting in smaller archives. By default, if Version Manager determines that a file is a text file (based on the extension), the tip revision of the file is saved in its entirety, while each non-tip revision is saved as a delta.

If workfiles are in binary format, the set of deltas is often as large as the workfile, which makes delta computations time-consuming. In this case, you might want to consider storing complete copies of the workfiles. By default, Version Manager does not store deltas for binary files.

See Also

Setting Archive Attributes Configuring Project File Type Options
